titleInfo.title: One Hundred and Fifty Dollars Reward.

mods.abstract: ONE HUNDRED AND FIFTY DOLLARS REWARD. -- Ran away on the 1st August, 1853, boy NICK ; he is a griffe, about 25 years of age, and about five feet six or seven inches high ; he has a scar on his neck. Ran away on the 8th August, 1853 boy BILL; he is short, black and thick set, aged about 22, and has been shot in both feet. Ran away in July, 1853, boy NED ; he is about six feet high, black, good-looking, and about 28 years of age. FIFTY DOLLARS REWARD will be paid for the return of any one of these Negroes, or ONE HUNDRED AND FIFTY DOLLARS for the return of all three, or on-half of the sums mentioned for positive information which will enable me to recover them. P.W. GREGORY, Executrix of the estate of G.G. Gregory, Island 98, Isasquena county, Miss. a15 1m
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
